questions.question: We stopped ...........................  a drink.
questions.description: When stop is followed by an infinitive, it indicates the purpose of an activity.

questions.question: I have stopped .......................... coffee.
questions.description: When stop is followed by an ing form, it shows the cessation of a habitual activity.

questions.question: She stopped ............................ when her daughter was born.
questions.description: When stop is followed by an ing form, it shows the cessation of a habitual activity.

questions.question: Remember ............................... him on Sunday. It is his birthday.
questions.description: When remember is followed by an infinitive, the reference is to future.

questions.question: I remember .................................. this place as a child.
questions.description: When remember is followed by an ing form, we are referring to the past.

questions.question: He suggested ……………………….. a break.
questions.description: Suggest cannot be followed by an infinitive.

questions.question: I regret .............................. school at
questions.description: Regret + ing form is used to talk about something happened in the past.

questions.question: We regret ............................... you that the flight has been cancelled.
questions.description: Regret + infinitive refers to the present or future.

questions.question: We regret ............................... you that your application has been rejected.
She tried ................................. but it was too painful.
